question.title: Use of java.util.concurrent.Executor stops tomcat from stopping

node.contents: I need to use java.util.concurrent.Executor to serialize the execution of some legacy code inside a WebService.

astNode.text: I need to use java.util.concurrent.Executor to serialize the execution of some legacy code inside a WebService.

node.contents: I have added an member variable, executor, to the WebService class. It is injected from the outside by the springframework.

astNode.text: I have added an member variable, executor, to the WebService class. It is injected from the outside by the springframework.

node.contents: The executor bean is defined as such:

astNode.text: The executor bean is defined as such:

node.contents: The WS works as expected. We rolled it out to a linux server. Then we realised the tomcat stop script could no longer stop the service.

astNode.text: The WS works as expected. We rolled it out to a linux server. Then we realised the tomcat stop script could no longer stop the service.

node.contents: I use kill -3 to the tomcat instance. In the thread dump I find these lines:

astNode.text: I use kill -3 to the tomcat instance. In the thread dump I find these lines:

elements.contents: "pool-2-thread-1" prio=10 tid=0xad637c00 nid=0xf37 waiting on condition [0xae882000..0xae883020] java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking) at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method) - parking to wait for <0xb453b710> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject) at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:158) at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1925) at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:358) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:946) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:906) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

fragments.text: "pool-2-thread-1" prio=10 tid=0xad637c00 nid=0xf37 waiting on condition [0xae882000..0xae883020]

node.contents: If you need more information, please suggest.

astNode.text: If you need more information, please suggest.

node.contents: It's neither Tomcat's nor Spring's fault. You just have to shutdown ExecutorService properly. Add destroy-method in bean definition:

astNode.text: It's neither Tomcat's nor Spring's fault. You just have to shutdown ExecutorService properly. Add destroy-method in bean definition:

node.contents: BTW singleton scope is default. You might also consider using shutdownNow() method. Also note that Spring provides powerful task scheduling mechanism.

astNode.text: BTW singleton scope is default. You might also consider using shutdownNow() method. Also note that Spring provides powerful task scheduling mechanism.

node.contents: your answer is just as good! I wish I can accept your answer too.

astNode.text: your answer is just as good! I wish I can accept your answer too.

node.contents: You need to find a way to call shutdown when the Spring context is shutdown: try using the bean destroy-method property and set that to shutdown. Something like this:
